docs.lead_paragraph: Six years ago a small Texas publisher released an obscure book written by a father-son research team. The work, based on a series of studies conducted in rural China and Taiwan, challenged the conventional wisdom about health and nutrition by espousing the benefits of a plant-based diet.

headline.main: Nutrition Advice From the China Study

docs.abstract: More than 500,000 copies of "The China Study" have been sold, and even former President Bill Clinton is talking about it.
docs.snippet: More than 500,000 copies of "The China Study" have been sold, and even former President Bill Clinton is talking about it.

docs.lead_paragraph: Last June, we published a case study that explored whether the natural soap maker True Body Products should add a scented offering. Janice Shade, True Body's chief executive, feared that adding the line might alienate existing customers who are adamantly opposed to scented soaps, sometimes because of allergies. But the suggestion to add the scented soaps came from Ms. Shade's North Atlantic region Whole Foods buyer, and Ms. Shade knew that a line extension would give her company the larger shelf presence it needed to increase sales, which were about $45,000 in 2009.

headline.main: A Start-Up Soap Maker Starts to Get Traction

docs.abstract: Janice Shade and True Body Products turned down a request from Whole Foods -- but are thriving anyway.
docs.snippet: Janice Shade and True Body Products turned down a request from Whole Foods -- but are thriving anyway.

docs.lead_paragraph: The city of Rio de Janeiro is infamous for the fact that one can look out from a precarious shack on a hill in a miserable favela and see practically into the window of a luxury high-rise condominium.  Parts of Brazil look like southern California.  Parts of it look like Haiti.  Many countries display great wealth side by side with great poverty.  But until recently, Brazil was the most unequal country in the world.

headline.main: To Beat Back Poverty, Pay the Poor

docs.abstract: A single social program is transforming how countries all over the world help their poor.
docs.snippet: A single social program is transforming how countries all over the world help their poor.

docs.lead_paragraph: Experts keep telling us to eat more fish — but who can afford it? This week’s recipes provide a solution to the problem by combining seafood with pasta. Today: pasta with beet greens and tuna.
